alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Douglas; South Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Carroll, Douglas and southwestern Fulton Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Bill Arp, or 7 miles south of Douglasville, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Douglasville, City of South Fulton, Villa Rica, Winston, Treasure Lake, Hannah, Campbellton, Bill Arp, Chapel Hill and Fairplay. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
